text: Rear Admiral Koos Louw (born 17 July 1952) is a retired South African Navy officer. He served as Flag Officer Commanding Naval Base Simon's Town twice, first from 1 April 1999 to 31 March 2005 and again from November 2006 to July 2012. He also served as Chief of Fleet Staff at Fleet Command (2005) and Director Fleet Logistics. == Honours and awards == * * * * * * * * * * * * x20px Grand OfficerOrder of Naval Merit (Brazil) * x20px Medal of Merit Santos Dumont (Brazil) * x20px Tamandaré Medal of Merit (Brazil) * x20px Officier Legion of Honour (France) * x20px Officer (Oficial - OIH) (Portugal) In 2010 Louw was awarded the Order of Prince Henry by Portugal's ambassador to South Africa. == References == Category:South African admirals Category:Living people Category:Officers of the Order of Prince Henry Category:1952 births
title: Koos Louw
